condition.description:
Atherosclerosis is a disease in which plaque builds up inside your arteries. Plaque is a sticky substance made up of fat, cholesterol, calcium, and other substances found in the blood. Over time, plaque hardens and narrows your arteries. That limits the flow of oxygen-rich blood to your body.

Atherosclerosis can lead to serious problems, including

  • Coronary artery disease. These arteries supply blood to your heart. When they are blocked, you can suffer angina or a heart attack.
  • Carotid artery disease. These arteries supply blood to your brain. When they are blocked you can suffer a stroke.
  • Peripheral arterial disease. These arteries are in your arms, legs and pelvis. When they are blocked, you can suffer from numbness, pain and sometimes infections.

Atherosclerosis usually doesn't cause symptoms until it severely narrows or totally blocks an artery. Many people don't know they have it until they have a medical emergency.

A physical exam, imaging, and other diagnostic tests can tell if you have it. Medicines can slow the progress of plaque buildup. Your doctor may also recommend procedures such as angioplasty to open the arteries, or surgery on the coronary or carotid arteries. Lifestyle changes can also help. These include following a healthy diet, getting regular exercise, maintaining a healthy weight, quitting smoking, and managing stress.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
indications: heart and blood vessel disease prevention
condition.name: Atherosclerosis

indications: Heart and blood vessel disease prevention

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Don't take antacids for at least 2 hours before and after taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

basics.benefits_moa: Crestor is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Crestor is one of the most effective statins to improve cholesterol, but it's expensive. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Slows down the buildup of fatty deposits in your blood vessels, otherwise known as hardening of the arteries.
In clinical studies, Crestor has the strongest effect on lowering "bad" cholesterol compared to other statins.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

drugs.name: Crestor

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Don't take antacids for at least 2 hours before and after taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Crestor have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Crestor have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Crestor. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your doctor. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.
risk_factors: Prior history of chronic liver disease

description_processed.orig: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Crestor. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your doctor. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Birth defects
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Crestor may cause birth defects including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Crestor may cause birth defects including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

carousel_items: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.
Check your blood sugar regularly.

basics.benefits_moa: Actos is an anti-diabetic drug. It improves your body's ability to use insulin to lower your blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Actos is a last-choice blood sugar-lowering medicine since it's only moderately effective but has a lot of undesirable side effects.
downsides: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

downsides_processed.orig: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

upsides: Oral blood sugar-lowering medicine.
Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Rarely causes low blood sugar.

upsides_processed.orig: Oral blood sugar-lowering medicine.
Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Rarely causes low blood sugar.

userStories.tip: Look out for overeating - Actos users tend to gain weight if they are not careful. Take it every evening before bedtime.
I take it just before bedtime for most effective results

drugs.name: Actos

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.
Check your blood sugar regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Problematic fluid build up from poor heart function (Congestive heart failure)
risks_warnings.description: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

description_processed.orig: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Edema)
risks_warnings.description: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

description_processed.orig: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

risks_warnings.title: Bladder cancer
risks_warnings.description: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

description_processed.orig: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fracture
risks_warnings.description: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

description_processed.orig: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

basics.benefits_moa: Atorvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Atorvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.
One of the strongest cholesterol-lowering statin medications.
A good option for people who have high cholesterol and diabetes.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

basics.benefits_moa: Simvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Simvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.
risk_factors: Combining Simvastatin with certain cholesterol-lowering drugs

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Simvastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Simvastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Certain drugs can increase the dose of Simvastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

description_processed.orig: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

carousel_items: Take it on an empty stomach.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.

clock.tip: Can take with or without food.

side_effects.name: Feeling cold in arms and legs

basics.benefits_moa: Atenolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it less work to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Atenolol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack with fewer side effects than other beta blockers. You have to take it on an empty stomach, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
At lower doses, Atenolol has fewer side effects than most beta blockers because it targets the heart and doesn't cross into the brain and central nervous system.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
At lower doses, Atenolol has fewer side effects than most beta blockers because it targets the heart and doesn't cross into the brain and central nervous system.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: If you are an endurance athlete or enjoy power yoga or hot yoga, I would HIGHLY advise against. Resulted in dizziness, white/purple extremities, and fainting that did not improve with time.
continues to work after 23 years. great medication!
This drug is amazing and the best drug that I have ever taken as far as noticable difference in heart effort!
userStories.identifier: very healthy 65 yo that had a heart atta

userStories.tip: No side effects noticed.

drugs.name: Atenolol

off-label_indications.indication: Heart and blood vessel disease prevention

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it on an empty stomach.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and insomnia.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or increased chest pain
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of rebound high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and headache.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release version. Also comes in immediate release called Lopressor (metoprolol tartrate).

clock.tip: Can take with or without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Toprol XL is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Toprol XL is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Toprol XL suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Toprol XL suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.
Toprol XL is the extended release version of Lopressor.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.

userStories.identifier: middle aged want to be outdoor

userStories.tip: One scary half faint (sank to my knees) was my body's reaction to starting this drug in very hot weather. Generally, I was fatigued & unusually sensitive to heat.  After a couple years all tiredness disappeared.

drugs.name: Toprol XL

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and headache.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release version. Also comes in immediate release called Lopressor (metoprolol tartrate).

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Toprol XL who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Toprol XL.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Toprol XL who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Toprol XL.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Toprol XL who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Toprol XL suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Toprol XL who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Toprol XL suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Toprol XL suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Toprol XL suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Toprol XL. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Toprol XL. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Toprol XL, so they can monitor your heart closely.

description_processed.orig: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Toprol XL, so they can monitor your heart closely.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Toprol XL has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Toprol XL should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Toprol XL has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Toprol XL should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.
